text:
Fast agglomerative clustering based on recursive nearest neighbor grouping.
ReNA yields very fast and accurate models, enabling to process large datasets on budget.
Unlike existing fast agglomerative schemes, it avoids the creation of giant clusters.

![parcellation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6594763/20935379/c3a03f2a-bbde-11e6-996d-45e16611caa2.png)
![original](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6594763/20935392/d0533dee-bbde-11e6-8add-3a3cc463960a.png)
![compression](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6594763/20935403/d7f163aa-bbde-11e6-93bc-f7462d570771.png)


Note: I put this in connectivity just to be consistent with the Ward clustering example, I'll probably put it in a "cluster" folder. 
Any ideas ?
title: ReNA: fast agglomerative clustering

text:
Fast agglomerative clustering based on recursive nearest neighbor grouping.
ReNA yields very fast and accurate models, enabling to process large datasets on budget.
Unlike existing fast agglomerative schemes, it avoids the creation of giant clusters.
